author: Chloe OKeeffe
text:
Longford Lotto players are being urged to check their tickets after one lucky punter matched five numbers and the bonus on Wednesday winning €87,233.
The winning Quick Pick ticket was bought on Sunday, March 10 at the Centre store at the Maxol service station on Athlone Road in Ballymahon, Co Longford .
Today's top videos STORY CONTINUES BELOW The winner is advised to sign the back of the ticket and keep it safe. The Match 5+Bonus winner is urged to contact the National Lottery prize claims team on 1800 666 111 or email claims@lottery.ie and arrangements can be made to claim the prize.
Longford Lotto players are being urged to check their tickets after one lucky punter matched five numbers and the bonus on Wednesday winning €87,233. Pic: Mark Stedman/Photocall Ireland. The winning numbers in the Wednesday, March 13, draw were: 02, 09, 23, 25, 28, 34 and the bonus number was 35.
A spokesperson for the National Lottery said more than 67,000 players win across the Lotto and Lotto Plus draws.
‘A Longford player took the title of biggest winner of the night after matching vie numbers and the bonus in the midweek draw to win €87,233,’ the spokesperson said.
The winning Quick Pick ticket was bought on Sunday, March 10 at the Centre store at the Maxol service station on Athlone Road in Ballymahon, Co Longford. Pic: Google Maps ‘The winner purchased their Quick Pick ticket on Sunday 10th March at the Centre store at the Maxol service station on the Athlone Road in Ballymahon.
‘We are urging all of our players who may have purchased their tickets at that particular service station over the weekend to carefully check their tickets.’
Meanwhile, with no outright winner of the €4,496,070 jackpot in Wednesday’s draw, Saturday’s jackpot is set to roll towards an estimated €5 million.
Tickets for the weekend draw can be purchased nationwide in-store, via the app or online at www.lottery.ie ahead of the 7.45pm cut-off time on Saturday evening. Pic: Robson90/Shutterstock Tickets for the weekend draw can be purchased nationwide in-store, via the app or online at www.lottery.ie ahead of the 7.45pm cut-off time on Saturday evening.
Almost 30c of every €1 spent on National Lottery games goes back to Good Causes across the areas of sport, youth, health, welfare, educations, arts, heritage and the Irish Language.
More than €6 billion has been raised for Good Causes since the establishment of the National Lottery 36 years ago.
Explainer: What happens to unclaimed Lotto jackpots? In 2022 alone, €259.5 million was raised for local Good Causes in communities across Ireland .
